de.bioforscher.singa.mathematics.vectors

Interface Vector

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Addable<Vector>, AdditivelyInvertible<Vector>, Divisible<Vector>, Invertible<Vector>, Metrizable<Vector>, MultiDimensional<Vector>, Multipliable<Vector>, Ring<Vector>, Subtractable<Vector>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RegularVector, Scalar, Vector2D, Vector3D

    public interface Vector
extends Ring<Vector>, MultiDimensional<Vector>, Divisible<Vector>, Metrizable<Vector>
    The Vector interface represents a collection of values where multiple operations are defined.

    Each implementation is: addable, subtractable, additively invertible, multipliable, divisible, and metrizable.

      • multiply

        Vector multiply(double scalar)
        The scalar multiplication is an algebraic operation that returns a new vector where each element is multiplied by the given scalar. This operation can also be thought of as "stretching" of the vector.
        Parameters:
        scalar - The scalar.
        Returns:
        The scalar multiplication.

      • divide

        Vector divide(double scalar)
        The scalar division is an algebraic operation that returns a new vector where each element is divided by the given scalar. This operation can also be thought of as "compressing" of the vector.
        Parameters:
        scalar - The scalar.
        Returns:
        The scalar multiplication.

      • normalize

        Vector normalize()
        The normalization or unit vector of a vector is a vector that points in the same direction as the original vector but has a magnitude of one.
        Returns:
        The normalized vector.

      • dotProduct

        double dotProduct(Vector vector)
        The dot product or scalar product is an algebraic operation that returns the sum of the products of the corresponding elements of the two vectors.
        Parameters:
        vector - Another vector of the same dimension.
        Returns:
        The dot product.
        Throws:
        IncompatibleDimensionsException - if this vector has another dimension than the given vector.

      • getMagnitude

        double getMagnitude()
        The magnitude or size gives the ordinary distance from the coordinate origin to the point represented by this vector.
        Returns:
        The magnitude or size of this vector.

      • dyadicProduct

        Matrix dyadicProduct(Vector vector)
        The numerical components of vectors can be arranged into row and column vectors. The dyadic product returns a matrix, where the element (i,j) is obtained by multiplying the i'th element of this vector with the j'th element of the other vector.
        Parameters:
        vector - Another vector of the same dimension.
        Returns:
        The matrix of the dyadic product

      • distanceTo

        default double distanceTo(Vector another)
        This method calculates the Eucledian distance between this vector and the given vector.

        The Euclidean distance is the "ordinary" (i.e. straight-line) distance between two vectors in Euclidean space.

        Specified by:
        distanceTo in interface Metrizable<Vector>
        Parameters:
        another - Another vector of the same dimension.
        Returns:
        The Euclidean distance.
        Throws:
        IncompatibleDimensionsException - if this vector has another dimension than the given vector.
        See Also:
        MinkowskiMetric
